TopicTitle: Does anyone else have issues with Imgur?

Articles.Content:
It connects slowly, and sometimes just doesn't connect. 

Uploading images is broken:

![51610d333745da40f6d1ebd3712810dd.png](https://i.gyazo.com/51610d333745da40f6d1ebd3712810dd.png)

Does anyone else have these problems?

Yes, when imgurians/redditors are spamming reposted memes it can get quite slow.

Try later when the majority of Americans are at work/school or asleep.

> 
> Yes, when imgurians/redditors are spamming reposted memes it can get quite slow.
> Try later when the majority of Americans are at work/school or asleep.

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Thanks for the fast answer.
Backbone connections between Verizon, SBC, Level3, and Savvis are having troubles this morning... high latency and packet loss.

You're right, there's currently critical packet loss between Savvis and Verizon as can be seen [**here**](http://internetpulse.net/).

Though global internet activity seems okay, see [**here**](http://www.internetweathermap.com/map) and [**here**](http://www.internettrafficreport.com/main.htm).

> 
> You're right, there's currently critical packet loss between Savvis and Verizon as can be seen [**here**](http://internetpulse.net/).
> Though global internet activity seems okay, see [**here**](http://www.internetweathermap.com/map) and [**here**](http://www.internettrafficreport.com/main.htm).

Heh heh... I view the same references, plus [this one](https://www.akamai.com/us/en/solutions/intelligent-platform/visualizing-akamai/real-time-web-monitor.jsp).

> 
> Does anyone else have issues with Imgur

Other than the commentators swearing like troopers..![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif) not much.
Yeah, it seems to be under heavy load.
Imgur has been acting up for over a week now.
Camp Imgur got back recently so everyone is overloading the site. It will probably be glitchy for a week or two.
Imgur has ALWAYS been horribly laggy and slow for me.

> 
> Camp Imgur got back recently so everyone is overloading the site. It will probably be glitchy for a week or two.

Camp Imgur!? What the BLEEP is Camp Imgur!?

> 
> Camp Imgur!? What the BLEEP is Camp Imgur!?

Large numbers of the Imgur community all went to a camp together and did fun stuff.

> 
> Large numbers of the Imgur community all went to a camp together and did fun stuff.

I decided to look up the website for it.

Oh good lord. 150 bucks (plus gas or plane ticket) to go to a "camp" thousands of miles away in California, a state I never want to visit, and do stuff in huge crowds of violent and possibly drunk people that I can do right now for free by myself in peace. No thank you.

> 
> I decided to look up the website for it.
> Oh good lord. 150 bucks (plus gas or plane ticket) to go to a "camp" thousands of miles away in California, a state I never want to visit, and do stuff in huge crowds of violent and possibly drunk people that I can do right now for free by myself in peace. No thank you.

Yeah. I came to a similar conclusion.

I have filtering software on my computer which when the word "California" pops up, I get a message that says 'You could care less about this' and then it moves me to the next page/article ... similar to my Kardashian filter, which groans in pain, farts, and then moves on.

![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
